conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B.
Pressure remains constant from A to B, indicating an isobaric process.
Work done in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Pressure at state A and B is 1 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at A is 3 L, Volume at B is 4 L.
Calculate change in volume: ΔV = 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
Convert volume from liters to cubic meters: 1 L = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate work done: W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3) = 100 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
